publisher.publisher-name: The Department of Plant Taxonomy and Ecology, L. Eötvös University

title-group.article-title: On the physiognomy of edaphic plant communities of the Bükk Mountains

permissions.copyright-statement: © Department of Plant Taxonomy and Ecology, ELTE

abstract.p: The climatically zonal forest communities of the Bükk Mts. exhibit a more or less regular altitudinal zonation. The variegated geomorphology and the resulting microclimatic and hydrographie conditions, as well as the diversity of parental materials are responsible for the complex mosaic and intricate successional relationships of intrazonal communities. This review discusses the physiognomic conditions of some edaphic communities and summarizes their successional relationships. Emphasis is placed on communities extensively studied for malacofauna in other papers in this volume; no attempt is made to give a full overview of all vegetation types of the mountains.
